tn.ref: these acts of faithfulness
tn.text: These acts were done by Hezekiah.

tn.ref: to stop up the waters of the springs that were outside the city
tn.text: They closed the springs that were outside the city so that people did not have access to water.

tn.ref: Why should the kings of Assyria come and find a lot of water?
tn.text: The kings of Assyria should not come and find a lot of water. Translators may want to translate "the king of Assyria," but they should translate "the kings of Assyria," because there is no support for a textual reading of "the king." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: took courage
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:2ch:15:08|15:8]]

tn.ref: Hezekiah took courage and built up
tn.text: AT: - "Hezekiah encouraged himself and the people to build up" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: the Millo
tn.text: This is a part of the wall that gives it strength.

tn.ref: for someone is with us who is greater than those with him
tn.text: AT: "for our God is with us and is more powerful than them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: an arm of flesh
tn.text: AT: "human power" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Lachish
tn.text: This was a city in Judah. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: What are you relying on in order to endure a siege in Jerusalem
tn.text: AT: "You are not able to endure a siege in Jerusalem." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Is not Hezekiah misleading you ... when he tells you, 'Yahweh ... Assyria'?
tn.text: AT: "Hezekiah is misleading you ... when he tells you, 'Yahweh ... Assyria.'" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Has not this same Hezekiah taken away
tn.text: AT: "This same Hezekiah has taken away"

tn.ref: Do you not know what ... lands?
tn.text: "You know very well what ... lands!" (See [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Were the gods of the people groups of the lands able ... power?
tn.text: "The gods of the people groups of the lands were not able ... power!" (See [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Among all the gods ... was there any god who ... hand?
tn.text: "There was no god among all the gods ... who ... hand!" (See [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Why should your God be able ... power?
tn.text: "There is no reason you God should be able ... power!" (See [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]]

tn.ref: to frighten them and trouble them
tn.text: These two phrases mean basically the same thing and emphasize the intensity of fear. AT: "to make them very afraid." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: They spoke of the God of Jerusalem as they had spoken of the gods of the other peoples of the earth
tn.text: AT: "They mocked the God of Jerusalem as they had mocked the gods of the other peoples of the earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] )

tn.ref: cried out to heaven
tn.text: AT: "pleaded to God"

tn.ref: shame-faced
tn.text: faced** - AT: "embarrassed" or "shamed"

tn.ref: the house of his god
tn.text: AT: "the temple of his god"

tn.ref: gave them rest on every side
tn.text: Here "rest" means "peace." AT: "gave them peace with all the neighboring countries" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] )

tn.ref: in the eyes of all nations
tn.text: AT: "so that all the surrounding people-groups knew" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

tn.ref: his heart was lifted up
tn.text: AT: "he became proud" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] )

tn.ref: stalls
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:2ch:09:25|9:25]]

tn.ref: pens
tn.text: A storage place for small animals.

tn.ref: waters of Gihon
tn.text: (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: The Vision of the Prophet Isaiah Son of Amoz ... The Book of the Kings of Judah and Israel
tn.text: These books no longer exist.

tn.ref: slept with his ancestors
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:2ch:09:29|9:31]]
